perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of twelve (12) full calendar months ("Initial Term"). The Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year terms (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides the other party written notification of its intent to terminate the Agreement no later than sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then applicable term. Except in instances of termination of this Agreement in accordance with Sections 10.2 and 10.3 below, this Agreement shall continue, even if terminated, until the expiration of the last Business Entity Term.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of twelve (12) full calendar months ("Initial Term"). The Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year terms (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides the other party written notification of its intent to terminate the Agreement no later than sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then applicable term. However, the agreement may not continue, even if terminated, until the expiration of the last Business Entity Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement will continue until the expiration of the last Business Entity Term, even if terminated. The modified version introduces a contradiction by stating it 'may not' continue, creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 2.4 Software Updates. iPass will notify Channel Partner regarding the availability of Updates and make any applicable Updates available to Channel Partner free of charge through the iPass portal and/or automatic downloads. Unless an Update has been delivered to Channel Partner as a patch to correct an urgent problem (in which case distribution to End Users will be immediate upon receipt), Channel Partner will distribute to its End Users all Updates within thirty (30) days of such Update being made available to Channel Partner. Failure to implement Updates may subject Channel Partner to various fees, including end of life fees, in iPass' sole discretion. Further iPass may implement end of life fees upon reasonable notice to Channel Partner.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.4 Software Updates. iPass will notify Channel Partner regarding the availability of Updates and make any applicable Updates available to Channel Partner free of charge through the iPass portal and/or automatic downloads. Unless an Update has been delivered to Channel Partner as a patch to correct an urgent problem (in which case distribution to End Users will be immediate upon receipt), Channel Partner should attempt to distribute to its End Users all Updates within thirty (30) days of such Update being made available to Channel Partner. Failure to implement Updates may subject Channel Partner to various fees, including end of life fees, in iPass' sole discretion. Further iPass may implement end of life fees upon reasonable notice to Channel Partner.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract language mandates the Channel Partner will distribute updates within 30 days. The modified language changes 'will distribute' to 'should attempt to distribute,' weakening the obligation. This introduces ambiguity, as it is unclear whether the Channel Partner will be penalized if they do not actually distribute the updates.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1 Fees. Channel Partner is solely responsible for billing End Users, and paying iPass for all usage of the Services. Channel Partner agrees to pay for usage of the Service on a monthly basis in accordance with the pricing set forth in Exhibit C. iPass may change the pricing in Exhibit C upon notice to Channel Partner, such changes to be effective within thirty (30) days after the date of such notice, such changes may include, by way of example only, the application of end of life fees.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 Fees. Channel Partner is solely responsible for billing End Users, and paying iPass for all usage of the Services. Channel Partner agrees to pay for usage of the Service on a monthly basis in accordance with the pricing set forth in Exhibit C. iPass may change the pricing in Exhibit C upon notice to Channel Partner, such changes may be effective within thirty (30) days after the date of such notice. The application of end of life fees will require mutual written agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives iPass the right to unilaterally change pricing, including applying end-of-life fees, with 30 days' notice. The modified text introduces the requirement of 'mutual written agreement' for end-of-life fees, conflicting with the previous statement and creating uncertainty about how such fees can be implemented.
